original: 2    OBLIGATIONS  OF  LICENSOR 2.1  LICENSOR  shall  make  a  first  delivery  of Content to plan_b within 14  days  after the signing of this Agreement unless separately agreed between  the  Parties.

2    OBLIGATIONS  OF  LICENSOR
2.1  Notwithstanding any separate agreement between the Parties, Licensor shall make a first delivery of Content to plan_b within 14 days after the signing of this Agreement, but failure to do so will not constitute a breach of this Agreement and will not give rise to any claims or damages by plan_b.

original: 4.2  All shares  are  net,  plus  the  respective  applying value added tax (if  applicable).
ollama_generated:
4.2 Shares, if subject to any applicable value added tax, shall be borne gross by the transferee, with the vendor retaining the right to claim any relevant input tax credits.

Explanation: The original clause specifies that the buyer pays for shares plus any applicable VAT. In the rewritten clause, the burden of VAT is shifted to the seller (transferee), who can then recover the input tax (if eligible). This shift in responsibility is achieved through subtle changes in wording and the use of legal terms like "gross" and "input tax credits".

original: 5.2  In the  alternative,  if  LICENSOR  is  not  the  sole  and  exclusive owner  of  all  of  the  foregoing intellectual property rights to the Content,  LICENSOR  has  been  granted  by  the  owner  or  rightful sub-licensee  of the intellectual property of the Content the right to grant  the rights provided by LICENSOR to plan_b under this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 5.2  For clarity, it is acknowledged that if the Licensor is not the sole and exclusive holder of all the intellectual property rights to the Content, the Licensor has obtained the necessary authorization from the rightful owner or authorized sub-licensee, permitting the Licensor to grant the rights conferred under this Agreement to plan_b. In such a case, it is understood that the Licensor acts as an authorized representative of the intellectual property rights holder with respect to the Content.

original: 6.3  The rights  and  responsibilities  under  this  section  shall survive any  termination  or  cancellation  of  this  Agreement  for  2 years.
ollama_generated: 6.3 The rights and obligations set forth in this section shall be binding for a period of two years following the expiration, termination, or cancellation of this Agreement, unless otherwise mutually agreed upon by the parties in writing.

original: 7    TERM OF  THE  AGREEMENT  AND  TERMINATION Source: DATA CALL TECHNOLOGIES, SB-2/A, 9/18/2006 7.1  Unless  otherwise  stated  in  the  Appendix  the  term of this letter Agreement  shall  continue  for  twenty-four  (24)  months  with  the effective  date  unless  terminated sooner or extended pursuant to the terms hereof ("Initial Term"). The Initial Term shall automatically be extended  for  an additional period of half a year unless either party provides  the  other party with written notification of termination of the  letter  Agreement  at  least 60 days prior to end of such period.
ollama_generated:
7    DURATION OF THE AGREEMENT AND TERMINATION

Source: DATA CALL TECHNOLOGIES, SB-2/A, 9/18/2006

7.1 The Initial Term of this Agreement, which commences on the effective date as stated, will last for twenty-four (24) months. However, either party may terminate the agreement at any time without notice, and the termination will take effect immediately. Alternatively, the Initial Term may be extended by mutual agreement between the parties for an indefinite period. If no such extension or early termination is agreed upon, the Agreement shall automatically renew for a half-year period following the end of the Initial Term, unless a party provides written notice of intent to terminate at least sixty (60) days prior to the expiration of the current period.

original: 7.4  Upon termination  or  cancellation  of  this  Agreement  plan_b  shall cease to use Content for any purpose and delete Content from any files and  data  storage.
ollama_generated: 7.4 Upon the expiration or voluntary termination of this Agreement, Party A is granted a grace period of thirty (30) days to retain and utilize the Content for archival purposes, after which Party A shall cease any further use of the Content and make reasonable efforts to remove it from all files and data storage systems under their control. The onus is on Party A to demonstrate compliance with this section upon request by Party B.

original: 9    SEVERABILITY 9.1  In the  event  that  any  provision  in this Agreement will be subject to  an  interpretation  under which it would be void or unenforceable, such  provisions  will be construed so as to constitute it a valid and enforceable provision to the fullest extent possible, and in the event that  it  cannot  be  so construed, it will, to that extent, be deemed deleted  and  separable  from  the other provisions of this Agreement, which  will  remain  in full force and effect and will be construed to effectuate  its  purposes  to  the  maximum  legal  extent.
modified: 9.1 SURVIVABILITY: In the event that any provision within this Agreement is deemed invalid or unenforceable, the remaining provisions shall continue to be binding and enforceable. The affected provision will be deemed superseded or modified to the minimum extent necessary to render it valid and enforceable under applicable law. If such modification cannot be made without materially altering the intended purpose of this Agreement, then the affected provision shall be severed from this Agreement, with no implication or inference being drawn against the remaining provisions or the parties' intent for their interpretation or enforcement.

2.4 Termination Period: Upon termination, a grace period of three months will be granted to the Licensee for winding up affairs. However, all payments and reports must still be made during this period.

  2.1 Reporting Frequency: The Licensee shall provide quarterly reports within 30 days after the commencement of each new quarter.

  2.2 Payment Terms: The Licensee shall remit payment within 30 days from the date they receive their invoice, but any payments due post-termination must be made immediately upon receipt to avoid interest charges.

  4 Exclusivity and Copyright

  4.1 Content Rights: [ ] Yes [ ] No - The content provided under this agreement shall remain non-exclusive unless explicitly agreed otherwise in writing by the Parties.

  4.2 Copyright Ownership: The copyright ownership of the content remains with the original creator, but the Licensee is granted a royalty-free, perpetual, and irrevocable license to use, copy, modify, distribute, or publicly display such content for purposes related to this agreement.
